alert.note: Alert for Louisa; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 8:06PM CST until March 07 at 12:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Iowa... Cedar River near Conesville affecting Louisa and Muscatine Counties. Iowa River at Marengo affecting Iowa and Benton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY, MARCH 07... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cedar River near Conesville. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to Tuesday, March 07. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water affects residences along County Road F70. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Monday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday afternoon to a crest of 13.8 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.
